image.altText: Julian and Stella embrace at Canberra Airport.

props.synopsis: Julian Assange has spent his first night home in Australia, after a legal saga that has lasted more than a decade. Assange's team says he is now a free man, and his wife says their reunion was a moment only an image can describe.

title.children: Julian Assange wakes as a free man, home in Australia with his family

image.altText: Julian assange salutes crowd

props.synopsis: Whether seen as a hero or villain, support for bringing Assange home eventually stretched across the political spectrum like few other issues, writes David Speers.

title.children: Albanese went out of his way to bring Assange back, yet he doesn't want to seem pro or anti the WikiLeaks founder

image.altText: The six politicians and two other men walk through a hallway.

props.synopsis: A cross-party delegation of jet-lagged and obstinate Australian parliamentarians arrived in Washington DC last September to advocate for Julian Assange's freedom. Those in the room reflect on how the "robust", and at times "aggressive", meeting went.

title.children: ‘There was an attempt to brush us away’: How six Australian MPs took the cause of Julian Assange to Washington

image.altText: A lady working on the details of a drawing.

props.synopsis: Before botanical illustrator Maura Chamberlain made her way to Macquarie Island, her experience with sub-Antarctic plants was limited to those in the local botanical gardens. Now she knows what it's like to walk through them.

title.children: How a 'fantastic adventure' to a sub-Antarctic wonderland inspired this botanical artist

image.altText: Houses lining a suburban street

props.synopsis: A higher-than-expected inflation number has dramatically raised the risk that the Reserve Bank will be forced to hike interest rates again as early as August.

title.children: This week's inflation number is a 'shocker' that puts 'enormous pressure' on the RBA to raise rates

image.altText: A woman standing at her front door wearing a purple sweater and wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: Robyn Hill, the wife of Victorian camper Russell Hill, says she is relieved former Jetstar pilot Greg Lynn was found guilty of the murder of Carol Clay, but disappointed he was acquitted over her husband's death.

title.children: 'We got the wrong result': Camper's widow speaks after Greg Lynn found not guilty of her husband's murder

image.altText: An aerial image of bushland with the faces of Greg Lynn, Carol Clay and Russell Hill on top.

props.synopsis: A camping trip brought Carol Clay and Russell Hill to a remote pocket of Victoria — but the pair would never emerge from the Wonnangatta Valley.

title.children: Mobile phone pings, a burnt-out campsite and the 'Button Man': Inside the missing campers investigation

image.altText: Zac Lomax celebrates scoring a try against the Maroons.

props.synopsis: New South Wales was dominant, Mitchell Moses steered the pack around the MCG like a dream, and Zac Lomax flew high in front of 90,084 at the MCG. Here's the five quick hits from State of Origin Game II.

title.children: Five quick hits: NSW vindicated with selection calls in huge Origin win, Blues flyer takes a 'speccy' at the 'G

image.altText: Jarome Luai and Brian To'o celebrate

props.synopsis: NSW scores six tries in a record-breaking first half to set up a dominant victory over Queensland in State of Origin II and send the series to a decider.

title.children: Blues batter Queensland in dominant State of Origin display to set up deciding Game III

image.altText: A blonde woman smiling with black round glasses.

props.synopsis: Media executive Judith Whelan has died aged 62 after battling cancer for several years. She is being remembered as a fierce role model and advocate for young reporters.

title.children: Media executive Judith Whelan remembered as 'true fighter' for journalism

image.altText: Bicycle bandit Kym Allen Parsons outside court.

props.synopsis: The South Australian bank robber dubbed the 'bicycle bandit' has died two days after being jailed for 35 years. Kym Allen Parsons had been granted access to voluntary assisted dying for stage 4 cancer, before he was sentenced for his crimes.

title.children: SA's notorious 'bicycle bandit' dies two days after being jailed for 35 years

props.synopsis: Greens MP Stephen Bates has asked Prime Minister Anthony Albanese to apologise after he joked about Peter Dutton's use of pronouns in Question Time on Wednesday.

title.children: 'Tasteless and unnecessary': Greens ask PM to apologise over Peter Dutton pronoun joke

image.altText: A smiling woman hugs a smiling man as they stand near trees and shrubs in yellow and red autumn colours.

props.synopsis: Foreigners in Indonesia say they are treated "just a little bit better than a tourist" despite having settled there for decades.

title.children: 'Our whole lives are here': Foreign citizens in Indonesia face eviction from their own homes over citizenship

image.altText: Ultra-Orthodox Jewish men staging a protest where they are holding up banners.

props.synopsis: The Supreme Court of Israel orders rules for the mandatory military enlistment of ultra-Orthodox Jewish men after finding their exemption on religious grounds legally untenable.

title.children: Ultra-Orthodox Jewish men to be conscripted by order of nation's top court

image.altText: Fatima Payman walks alongside David Pocock as she crosses the floor to vote against Labor

props.synopsis: Fatima Payman is the embodiment of some of Australia's most marginalised people — young, Muslim and a woman. Though she might be diminutive in stature, she stared down the Labor Party machine and fearlessly defied those who wanted her to toe the line.

title.children: Flanked by a man mountain, Fatima Payman found sanctuary in defying her party

image.altText: A young woman in a multicoloured jumper looks off camera

props.synopsis: Robbie Geeves, whose parents are accused of murdering Amber Haigh in a plot to gain custody of her son, told the court his parents confronted him after he refused to accept the newborn boy as his brother.

title.children: 'It wasn't right': Son of accused killers tells court his ex-girlfriend Amber Haigh had a baby with his father

image.altText: Cate Campbell holds both hands to her face, blowing a kiss towards the crowd

props.synopsis: More than a week on from her emotional finale at the Australian Olympic Trials, swimming great Cate Campbell officially calls time on her stellar career.

title.children: 'I am entering my cheerleader era': Cate Campbell officially retires from swimming

image.altText: A woman with a large brow and nose looking off into the distance

props.synopsis: A new study suggests ancient humans provided altruistic care for community members, after finding evidence of Down syndrome in a Neanderthal child.

title.children: 'There's compassion': Neanderthals may have cared for a six-year-old with Down syndrome

image.altText: A man and a woman stand together in an office.

props.synopsis: In what one expert has likened to a plot from the political satire programs Utopia or Yes Minister, a report detailing ways to improve the processes by which the Tasmanian government can be more transparent to the public is released — with the suggested improvements blacked out in page after page of redactions.

title.children: 'Like something out of Utopia or Yes Minister': Proposed solutions to secrecy issues kept secret

image.altText: boxes on the ground of a patterned carpet

props.synopsis: New photos show the extent of the "clutter" faced by FBI agents, who were forced to search the building in "filter teams" to avoid accidentally viewing top secret material.

title.children: New photos show the extent of Trump's 'cluttered' storage of classified documents at Mar-a-Lago

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie and shades

props.synopsis: Three men are on trial for allegedly sexually assaulting three women during a bucks weekend at an Airbnb in Newcastle in 2022.

title.children: Woman sent text to friend saying 'help me now' before allegedly being sexually assaulted, court told

image.altText: A man with a shaven head with a blank expression.

props.synopsis: Prosecutors say the Wall Street Journal reporter gathered secret information on the orders of the US Central Intelligence Agency about a company that manufactures tanks for Russia's war in Ukraine. If convicted, he faces a sentence of up to 20 years.

title.children: Russia starts closed-door espionage trial for Wall Street Journal reporter

image.altText: The outside of a shopping centre

props.synopsis: Six teenagers charged over an incident outside a shopping centre in Adelaide's north-west – which allegedly involved "swinging a large knife" – had been trying to escape an adult who had been "consistently pursuing" the group, a court has heard.

title.children: Teenagers trying to escape man who allegedly hit one of them with 'metal baseball bat', court hears

image.altText: Rosie Malone runs carrying her stick during a game

props.synopsis: The Hockeyroos squad for the Olympics will not be revealed until next week, but star attacker Rosie Malone is set to be a shock omission.

title.children: 'I'm looking at a walking ghost': Former Hockeyroo says she is shocked by star's omission from Olympic squad

image.altText: Naked protesters stand with their backs to the camera on a beach.

props.synopsis: A popular nudist beach on the NSW far north coast will soon close after the state's National Parks and Wildlife Service found no alternative for a clothing-optional area.

title.children: Naturist says Byron Bay nudist beach closure unlikely to stop visitors stripping down

image.altText: Man in black top sitting in a group with students.

props.synopsis: As Tasmania's multicultural community reports a rise in race-based crime, a grassroots organisation heads to schools to teach young people to embrace diversity.

title.children: Amid reports of rising youth and racist crimes, this Hobart school is taking action

image.altText: a whale swimming in the ocean off Victoria's east coast tangled in ropes, lines and buoys

props.synopsis: Authorities have called for help to find a whale that was seen tangled in ropes and buoys off the Gippsland coast in Victoria.

title.children: Rescuers search for humpback whale seen tangled in 200 metres of rope

image.altText: A man in suit walks outside court house

props.synopsis: Assange has been released after pleading guilty to a felony count of obtaining and disclosing national defence information, bringing to a close a legal battle more than a decade long.

title.children: Julian Assange's lawyer says WikiLeaks founder 'cannot be silenced' despite guilty plea to espionage charge

image.altText: A smiling baby with mouth open.

props.synopsis: When Amelia Crispin was 17 she found out she was born without a uterus. But she didn't let her diagnosis stop her from having her own child.

title.children: Meet baby Howie, one of the few children born via altruistic surrogacy so far this year

image.altText: a woman holds a vape as she blows smoke out of her mouth while walking outdoors

props.synopsis: The Coalition has been ruminating internally over how to handle the government's impending vape ban. Who would have thought they would land on option two: inhale, reverse the ban, bring in a new tax and declare war on organised crime.

title.children: With a puff of smoke, it's on like Donkey Kong: Dutton taps in to the vape wars

image.altText: A boy with MrBeast written on his forehead

props.synopsis: American YouTube star James Donaldson, better known as his online moniker MrBeast, hosts one of his signature viral stunts at the Opera House.

title.children: Thousands turn out at Sydney Opera House to meet world's biggest YouTube star

image.altText: Luna Park's entrance is a big smiling clown

props.synopsis: The heritage-listed amusement park on Sydney's harbour foreshore was acquired by an investment firm in 2007, and Luna Park CEO John Hughes says it is the right time to sell.

title.children: Always wanted your own amusement park? There's one with a great view for sale
